thread.title: Eleven from Netflix's Stranger Things has a brand new look for season two
thread.title_full: Eleven from Netflix's Stranger Things has a brand new look for season two

author: Joshua Haigh
title: Eleven from Netflix's Stranger Things has a brand new look for season two
text:
Eleven from Netflix's Stranger Things has a brand new look for season two The Netflix series is coming back - but things are going to be different the second time around Share She's got a new look (Photo: Copyright unknown) Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Stranger Things fans are preparing for season two, but we still don't know much about what to expect. 
The sci-fi show became a huge success for Netflix when it arrived on the streaming service last year, and was quickly renewed. 
The new season season kicks off in 1984 - a year after the events of season one - and very little has been revealed so far. 
Executive producer Shawn Levy had already given EW, where a sneak peek was first shown, a little tease of what was to come. “The Demogorgon was destroyed but evil wasn’t,” he said. Eleven looks very different (Photo: Entertainment Weekly) The series returns soon (Photo: Netflix) 
But with the stars of the show posing on the cover of entertainment weekly, fans have finally been given another glimpse of what's to come. 
Eleven, who was known for her shaved-head look in the first season, is now sporting a mass of curly hair. But what could it mean? Read More Stranger Things season 2 Super Bowl trailer reveals release date - and we have to wait awhile 
Speaking about her rise to fame, Eleven actress Millie Brown told the magazine: “I went to Manila last year; there were people camping outside the hotel, crying, and literally hyperventilating. I was like, ‘Why do you like me so much? I’m just boring old Millie.” What horror awaits them? (Photo: Netflix) Will they all survive? (Photo: Netflix) 
Gaten Matarazzo, who plays Dustin, added: “I always joke around with the Duffers [Brothers, creators], ‘Why couldn’t you make the first season just okay ?’ It’s like how they never expected Barb to be a hit — they never expected the show to be as successful.” 
Stranger Things 2 , stars Winona Ryder , David Harbour, Paul Reiser, Sean Astin, Millie Bobby Brown, Noah Schnapp, and Matarazzo, Wolfhard, and McLaughlin. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
